modules.description: Provides asynchronous I/O operations such as reading from and writing to sockets, handling TLS connections, and managing network configurations. Works with Lwt-based promises, IP addresses as strings, and TLS client configurations. Used to implement non-blocking network communication in server and client applications.

Provides asynchronous and synchronous message handling, connection management, and event dispatching for IRC protocols. Works with socket connections, message parsers, and event handlers. Used to build real-time chat clients and bot interactions with customizable event responses.

handles asynchronous network communication through Lwt, supporting TLS-encrypted socket interactions, IP address manipulation, and configuration management. It enables non-blocking read and write operations, secure connection establishment, and flexible network setup. Users can manage TLS client settings, route data over encrypted channels, and integrate with event-driven architectures. Examples include establishing secure chat connections, streaming data over TLS, and configuring custom network policies.
